private_information: May interact only with vowel blocks: A, E, I.
Can hold at most one block at a time.
Can only pick up the top block of a stack.
Cannot place a held block on top of a block currently held by the other agent.
VA.goal: Cooperate to achieve the final stacks while only manipulating vowel blocks (A, E, I).

private_information: May interact only with consonant blocks: B, C, D, F, G.
Can hold at most one block at a time.
Can only pick up the top block of a stack.
Cannot place a held block on top of a block currently held by the other agent.
CA.goal: Cooperate to achieve the final stacks while only manipulating consonant blocks (B, C, D, F, G).

private_information: Responsible for producing a PDDL domain and problem that coordinate VA and CA under the given constraints.
Must ensure the model enforces access, holding, interaction restrictions, interference rules, and stack limit (<=3).
orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem encoding the dual-agent blocks task and constraints so a planner can find a valid sequence of moves to reach the goal.

public_information: Blocks world with stacks on a table.
Only top blocks may be picked up.
Each agent may hold at most one block.
A held block cannot be placed on top of a block held by the other agent.
At most 3 stacks may exist on the table at any time.
Blocks present: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, I.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling for cooperative block-manipulation tasks. You will be provided the environment initial state, goal, public facts, and the private constraints of each agent. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that capture the dual-agent blocks world, enforcing access to top blocks only, single-item holding per agent, vowel/consonant interaction restrictions for VA and CA respectively, the interference constraint (cannot place onto a block held by the other agent), and a hard constraint that the number of table stacks never exceeds 3. Keep actions distinct by agent (e.g., pick-va, place-va, pick-ca, place-ca). Return only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively, and nothing else.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
VA's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->VA->private_information}.
CA's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->CA->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
